intro: Leiophaca purpurea, commonly known as the purple-leaved daisy, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family and is characterized by its vibrant purple foliage and daisy-like flowers. The plant typically grows in well-drained soils and thrives in full sun to partial shade. Its ornamental value is due to its striking coloration and compact growth habit. Leiophaca purpurea is often used in rock gardens and as a decorative plant in landscapes.
